description: The Thing Protocol Error Response is sent in response to a command that failed during execution.
title: Thing Protocol Error Response

correlation-id.description: The correlation-id header is used for linking one message with another. It typically links a reply message with its requesting message.

path.description: The path is always `/` for error responses.

value.description: The _value_ field contains information about the error that occurred.

status.description: The status code that indicate the result of the command. The semantics of the used status codes are based on the [HTTP status codes](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6).

error.description: The error code that uniquely identifies the error e.g. `things:features.notfound`.

message.description: A human readable message that explains in detail what went wrong during the execution of a command.

description.description: Contains further information about the error e.g. a hint what caused the problem and how to solve it.

status.description: The status code that indicate the result of the command. The semantics of the used status codes are based on the [HTTP status codes](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6).
